translated: Homage to that Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Rightly Self-awakened One.

original: nakusalo ca naakusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—kusale khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.🔽Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—akusale khandhe paṭicca
analyzed: na kusalaḥ ca na akusalaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccaya akusale khandhe paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa  akusalam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusale khandhe paṭicca
translated: Skillful and unskillful thoughts arise with a cause that is a condition: the four formless constituents of wholesome thoughts condition the form that is derived from consciousness.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—akusalaṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… akusalaṁ dhammaṁ

translated: An unskillful thought arises with an unskillful thought as its cause that is a condition: the four formless constituents of an unskillful thought condition the form that is derived from consciousness. An unskillful thought arises with a skillful thought as its cause that is a condition: one of the four formless constituents of an unskillful thought conditions the three other formless constituents and the form that is derived from consciousness.🔽An unskillful thought arises with an indeterminate thought as its cause that is a condition: one of the four formless constituents of an unskillful thought conditions the three other formless constituents and the form that is derived from consciousness.

original: paṭicca naabyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo🔽ca naabyākato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo🔽ca naakusalo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.

translated: An unskillful thought arises with a skillful and an indeterminate thought as its cause that is a condition: one of the four formless constituents of an unskillful thought conditions the three other formless constituents and the form that is derived from consciousness.🔽An unskillful thought arises with a skillful and an unskillful thought as its cause that is a condition: one of the four formless constituents of an unskillful thought conditions the three other formless constituents and the form that is derived from consciousness.

original: Abyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— vipākābyākataṁ kiriyābyākataṁ

translated: An indeterminate thought arises with an indeterminate thought as its cause that is a condition: a resultant indeterminate thought conditions the four formless constituents and the form that is derived from consciousness. A functional indeterminate thought conditions the four formless constituents and the form that is derived from consciousness.

An unwholesome state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome state. An unwholesome state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome and a neither-unwholesome-nor-wholesome state.

original: Akusalo dhammo nakusalassa ca naakusalassa ca dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: akusalaḥ dhammaḥ na kusalassa ca na akusalassa ca dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: An unwholesome state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for an unwholesome and a wholesome state.

original: Abyākato dhammo nakusalassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Abyākato dhammo naakusalassa
analyzed: abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na kusalassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na akusalassa
translated: An indeterminate cause is a condition, by way of being a cause condition, for a wholesome state …🔽An indeterminate cause is a condition, by way of being a cause condition, for an unwholesome state …

original: dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. Abyākato dhammo nakusalassa ca naakusalassa ca dhammassa🔽hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Kusalo dhammo nakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo …. (Cha pañhā.)
analyzed: dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na kusalassa ca na akusalassa ca dhammassa  hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  kusalaḥ dhammaḥ na kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cha pañhā
translated: An indeterminate cause is a condition, by way of being a cause condition, for a wholesome and an unwholesome state.🔽A wholesome object is a condition, by way of object condition, for an unwholesome state … (Six questions.)

original: Akusalo dhammo naakusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo …. (Cha pañhā.)
analyzed: akusalaḥ dhammaḥ na akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cha pañhā
translated: An unwholesome object is a condition, by way of object condition, for an unwholesome state … (Six questions.)

original: Abyākato dhammo naabyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo …. (Cha pañhā, saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: abyākataḥ dhammaḥ na abyākatassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cha pañhā saṅkhitta
translated: An indeterminate object is a condition, by way of object condition, for an indeterminate state … (Six questions, in brief.)

original: Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe aṭṭhārasa, adhipatiyā sattarasa, anantare soḷasa, samanantare
analyzed: hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe aṭṭhārasa adhipatiyā sattarasa anantare soḷasa samanantare
translated: As a cause, thirteen; as object, eighteen; as predominance, seventeen; as proximity, sixteen; as contiguity, sixteen;

original: soḷasa, sahajāte ekūnavīsa, aññamaññe nava, nissaye chabbīsa, upanissaye aṭṭhārasa,
analyzed: soḷasa sahajāte ekūnavīsa aññamaññe nava nissaye chabbīsa upanissaye aṭṭhārasa
translated: as arising together, nineteen; as mutuality, nine; as support, twenty-two; as decisive support, eighteen;

original: purejāte cha, pacchājāte nava, āsevane nava, kamme terasa, vipāke tīṇi, āhāre terasa
analyzed: purejāte cha pacchājāte nava āsevane nava kamme terasa vipāke tīṇi āhāre terasa
translated: There are six in the prenascent, nine in the postnascent, nine in the conascent, thirteen in the kamma, three in the result, thirteen in nutriment,

original: …pe… magge terasa, sampayutte nava, vippayutte dvādasa …pe… avigate chabbīsa. (Pañhāvāraṁ vitthāretabbaṁ.)
analyzed: pe magge terasa sampayutte nava vippayutte dvādasa pe avigate chabbīsa pañhā vāram
translated: … and so on … thirteen in the path, nine in the associated, twelve in the dissociated, … and so on … twenty-six in the unobscured-neutral. The section consisting of questions is to be elaborated in detail.
